programme.title: US Closing Bell S2
programme.desc: Hosted by Sara Eisen and Wilfred Frost, Closing Bell brings you coverage of the final and most important hour of the trading day. The show provides insight to traders and investors by interviewing experts, CEOs and analysts, listening to their observations on the movements in the market. With live reports from stock exchanges across the USA, aspiring investors are given an informative platform from which to make informed and sensible decisions. Closing Bell also presents analysis of profit reports from a number of different corporations and speaks with wealthy executives who reveal how they spend their money and time.

programme.title: Neste S1
programme.desc: Neste Finnish refinery group, Neste, has built the world's largest sustainable aviation fuel production plant in Singapore. Christine Tan speaks to Neste's President and CEO, Matti Lehmus, to find out more about the company's renewable fuel strategy and whether he has plans to wind down its traditional crude oil refinery business.

programme.title: The Edge (Dutch Water Tech) S1 (n°73)
programme.desc: «Dutch Water Tech»As the climate changes, sea levels are predicted to rise, and extreme weather events are set to increase in frequency and intensity. In this episode of The Edge, CNBC's Julianna Tatelbaum travels to the Netherlands to explore Dutch innovations that help keep water at bay.

programme.title: Nimsdai "Nims" Purja S1
programme.desc: He climbed 14 of the world's highest peaks in just six months and six days. CNBC's Tania Bryer sits down with record-breaking mountaineer Nimsdai "Nims" Purja to discuss his extraordinary journey.

programme.title: Answers with Bayless Conley (The Ups and Downs of Faith) S3 (n°13)
programme.desc: «The Ups and Downs of Faith»In his encouraging message "The Ups and Downs of Faith," Pastor Bayless Conley gives you practical, biblical wisdom for how to face times of discouragement as you trust God and lean into Him no matter what challenges life brings.

programme.title: Secret Lives of the Super Rich (The Mansion That Patron Built & A Diamond In the Rough) S1 (n°602)
programme.desc: «The Mansion That Patron Built & A Diamond In the Rough»Take a tour of the nearly $50M party mansion that's the throne to an alcohol empire. Rock out with the giant rough diamond that's so unique, even a $61M offer couldn't cut it. Raise the bar with a $35K bottle of whiskey. Experience surf and turf Lamborghini style with a $2M speed boat built to match a $650K sports car. See how Cher's former mega-home is being transformed into an $85M heaven for horses. Take an adrenaline-filled ride down memory lane with vintage trucks restored for up to $300K. Step inside the $25M bulletproof penthouse that's covered in exotic animal furs. Get in the driver's seat of the nearly $20M Alfa Romeo that just shattered a world record at auction. And lace up in luxury with a $4M pair of sneakers.

programme.desc: Neste Finnish refinery group, Neste, has built the world's largest sustainable aviation fuel production plant in Singapore. programme.desc: The PGA TOUR's Florida Swing wraps up at the Valspar Championship, where Sam Burns looks for his third win in a row at Innisbrook.

programme.title: World Sailing Show S2
programme.desc: On this month's World Sailing Show SailGP brewing up a storm down under, RORC take a trip round the Caribbean, and the iQFoils stop off in Japan.

programme.title: The Armageddon Championship Series
programme.desc: The America's series begins this year's Championship, with some of the region's best players competing over 7 days and 14 matches.

programme.title: Cyclisme : Tour d'Arabie saoudite
programme.desc: See all the action and most memorable moments from the Tour of Saudi Arabia, a professional cycling stage race that is a part of the UCI Asia Tour.

programme.title: La fièvre du dollar (The Art of the Steal / The Folsom Felon) S1 (n°47)
programme.desc: «The Art of the Steal / The Folsom Felon»"The Art of the Steal" Larry Salander is one of the biggest names in New York's art world. But collectors see red when he swipes more than $100 million from their pockets. "The Folsom Felon" Stefan Wilson says his investment fund is a sure-fire winner. Investors even mortgage their homes to join his fund. But business with Wilson comes at a very high price.
